trans-unit.source: Provides a component editor for <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection"></xref> objects in the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> class provides a user interface for editing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> elements of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> objects in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control at design time, under the control of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuDesigner> object.

There is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> associated with each of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelMenuItemStyles%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSelectedStyles%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.
These <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection> objects are used to apply styles to menu items that depend on their level (nesting depth) in the menu structure.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> is invoked, for example, by selecting the ellipsis button (**…**) on the **LevelMenuItemStyles** or **LevelSelectedStyles** row in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CanSelectMultipleInstances%2A> method always returns `false` to indicate that only one object can be selected at a time in the editor.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateCollectionForm%2A> method creates a new form to display and edit the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateInstance%2A> method creates a new instance of the specified collection item type.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateNewItemTypes%2A> method returns an array of types that the editor can create.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor"></xref> class.

The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> class when you select, for example, the ellipsis button (**…**) on the **LevelMenuItemStyles** or **LevelSelectedStyles** row in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer when designing a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control or a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the collection to edit.
Gets a value indicating whether multiple <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> elements can be selected in the editor at one time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CanSelectMultipleInstances%2A> method always returns `false`; thus, only one <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object can be selected at a time in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> object.
Always `false`.
Creates a new form to display and edit the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollection"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateCollectionForm%2A> method calls the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CreateCollectionForm%2A> base method to create the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> form, and then formats a caption for the form.
An instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CollectionForm"></xref> to use as the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor"></xref>.
Creates a new instance of the specified collection item type.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateInstance%2A> method is used to create new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor.CreateInstance%2A> calls the <xref:System.Activator.CreateInstance%2A> method to access the activation methods for late-bound support.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of item to create.
A new instance of the specified type, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref>.
Gets the data types that this collection editor can create.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor> object can create <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> type objects.
A type array of the data types the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.MenuItemStyleCollectionEditor"></xref> can create.
